Morgan and Company, are arriving this afternoon from Europe on the North German Lloyd liner Bremen. Others coming from the Channel ports on the ship include Joseph E. Widener and Mr. and Mrs. P.A.B. Widener and:

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3. -- South American business, except for Uruguay, has shown encouraging tendencies recently, according to reports made public today in the Department of Commerce's weekly survey of foreign business.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3. -- South American business, except for Uruguay, has shown encouraging tendencies recently, according to reports made public today in the Department of Commerce's weekly survey of foreign business.

headline.main: TRADE GAINS MADE IN LATIN AMERICA; Reports Are Encouraging in Most Countries to the South Except Uruguay.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Both credit and collection conditions in Latin-American markets showed marked improvement in the second quarter of this year, according to a report made public yesterday by the foreign department of the National Association of Credit Men.

headline.main: MEXICO RATED 'GOOD' IN CREDIT SUMMARY; Leads All Other Latin-American Countries in Second Quarter Rating by Association.
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED AUG. 4, 1934.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6. -- Gross exports to every grand division increased in June over June, 1933, the increases covering every subdivision except France, Germany, Hong Kong, Italy and the Philippine Islands, the Department of Commerce announced today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6. -- Gross exports to every grand division increased in June over June, 1933, the increases covering every subdivision except France, Germany, Hong Kong, Italy and the Philippine Islands, the Department of Commerce announced today.

headline.main: JUNE EXPORTS ROSE TO MOST COUNTRIES; Commerce Report Shows Gain in Shipments to Nearly All Parts of World.
